The tuita counsel now press statement from President Dilma after meeting with the President of Korea. #BrasilCoreia
RT @blogplanalto: #AoVivo Statement by the President @dilmabr on the occasion of the official visit of the President of Korea, Park Geun-hye: http: //t....
We are honored to have the visit of the President of the Republic of Korea, Park Geun-hye, on her first visit to Brazil.
We are celebrating the strengthening of the ties between our countries, which have been favored by the progress of the last decade. #BrasilCoreia
His presence among us, with a large business delegation, reflects the friendship and understanding that animates relations between Korea and Brazil.
It also expresses the reciprocal desire to deepen bilateral cooperation in the most diverse fields. #BrasilCoreia
Reforms are paying off. Ireland, Slovenia, Portugal, Spain and my own country - Latvia - grow faster after having Reformed. #ECOFIN
Korea was the 1st Asian country to engage in # ScienceSemFronts, having already received 525 Brazilian scholarship holders in its universities.
The internship opportunities offered by Korean companies - most of them with important investments in Brazil - are fundamental (...)
(...) for the qualification of the academic formation and for the future interaction between the private sectors of the two countries.
Our trade is prosperous and despite the negative effects of the crisis, it has been growing steadily, with a 65% increase since 2009.
In 2014, Korea was Brazil's 7th largest trading partner in the world and the 3rd in Asia, with a total exchange of $ 12 billion.
We are, in Latin America, Korea's largest trading partner and the main destination of its investments.
There is room for new efforts to diversify bilateral trade through greater value added in Brazilian exports.
This trend will be strengthened with the two agreements we have signed today in the area of ​​trade facilitation (...)
(...) and promotion of business between micro, small and medium enterprises. #BrasilCoreia
The agreements in the field of Information and Communication Technologies signed hj create a program of cooperation (...)
(...) which will bring together companies, universities and research centers. #BrasilCoreia
These joint initiatives will generate business opportunities and the development of innovative products (...)
(...) of high technological content, that meet the national and international markets. #BrasilCoreia

“On this beach, on this day, at this hour, exactly 100 years ago, the first Anzac troops came ashore.” #Anzac100
"Gallipoli to us Kiwis means not only this sea, this beach, these cliffs and the narrows across the hills..." #Anzac100
"... It means the names and stories of more than 2,700 New Zealanders who died here." #Anzac100
"Gallipoli is also a byword for the best characteristics of Australians and New Zealanders." #Anzac100
"While this was a place of courage and heroism and duty, it was also a place of fear and waste and loss." #Anzac100
"The generosity of Turkey in welcoming us back here... means that Gallipoli also symbolises the healing power of time." #Anzac100
"After one hundred years we can say, on this day April 25, 2015, 'We remember'." #Anzac100 http://t.co/592rC7JLf0
